topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559318d4636872263d000fb4#post_559318d4636872263d000fb4
[bq="uc9"]I had a interesting thought:
Have you ever wondered why we don't have real life superheroes like Ironman or such?  Easy: metal helmet.  If someone with enough money were to drop tens of billions of dollars on such a suit all you would need to do is use a bunch of thick ass oven mits to grab a lose electric cable then shock them in the head (please don't grab electric cables); the electricity would roll around in the person's body and catch their hair on fire and potentially explode the person's head inside the suit like a watermelon being exploded by a fire cracker.

Even a tazer could take the person out; just smack them in the head with a tazer and having a thousand volts roll around in their brain wouldn't kill them but it would send them to the emergency room with the person convulsing on the floor.

Tl:dr; metal helmet + electricity = bad idea

It's also why we don't have power armor like in Fallout.[/bq]
Eh, the helmet just need something that could protect the head from the electricity. Something simple, like rubber or something.
And the armors will be only in for wars. Who will bring a giant electric cable to the battlefield anyway?

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5593196163687267d1001c92#post_5593196163687267d1001c92
When you get down to it's not that certain types of superheroes couldn't be done, but rather you would make it all of two seconds in the real world.

If batman existed you would get shot in the mouth.

Invisibility *MIGHT* in a couple decades be possible with optic camouflage, but then you could just pop on thermal goggles and you would show up like a sore thumb.

Guns > martial arts

etc

. . Don't even get me started on superman or the hulk or one punch man or such.  If you tied someone to a nuke or they were within 1000m they would get carbonized.

topics.body:
For those of you that are probably thinking "nuh-uh!  <Superman/the hulk/etc> could survive anything if they were real" let me show you a picture:
!http://i.imgur.com/iyJ0umR.jpg!
That *WAS* a person before Hiroshima.  I don't mean as in that was the person's shadow, or that was a light blasted onto the concrete, or anything what you are thinking; that "shadow" on the concrete *WAS* a person.

If you're close enough to a nuke when it goes off you instantly get vaporized and your carbon gets physically etched into what it behind you.
!https://poisonandvision.files.wordpress.com/2011/10/hiroshima_shadow.jpg!
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
